sentences.text: 2017 PROXY STATEMENT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Patricia F. Russo Chair of the Board
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Hewlett Packard Enterprise Company 3000 Hanover Street Palo Alto, CA 94304 www.hpe.com
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To our fellow Stockholders:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are pleased and excited to invite you to attend the second annual meeting of stockholders of Hewlett Packard Enterprise Company on Wednesday, March 22, 2017 at 9:00 a.m., Pacific Time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The annual meeting is a time for us to reflect on our first year of business and share our business strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have much to be proud of including our business performance, our best-in-class governance profile, and our transformative portfolio alignment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also have much work to do, as we head into our second year with a ision, strategy, and leadership team fully focused on accelerating next.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This year's annual meeting will again be a completely virtual meeting of stockholders, which will be conducted via live webcast.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You will be able to attend the annual meeting of tockholders online and submit your questions during the meeting by visiting HPE.onlineshareholdermeeting.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You also will be able to vote your shares electronically at he annual meeting (other than shares held through our 401(k) Plan, which must be voted prior to the meeting).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Hosting a virtual meeting will facilitate stockholder attendance and participation by enabling our stockholders to participate fully from any location around the world.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the online format will allow us to communicate with you in advance of the meeting by visiting www.proxyvote.com for beneficial owners and proxyvote.com/hpe for registered stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Details regarding how to attend the meeting online and the business to be conducted at the annual meeting are more fully described in the accompanying Notice of Annual Meeting and Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are pleased to provide access to our proxy materials over the Internet under the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission's "notice and access" rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, we are mailing to many of our stockholders a notice of Internet availability instead of a paper copy of this proxy statement and our 2016 Annual Report.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The notice contains instructions on how to access those documents over the Internet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The notice also contains instructions on how each of those stockholders can receive a paper copy of our proxy materials, including this proxy statement, our 2016 Annual Report, and a form of proxy card or voting instruction card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All stockholders who do not receive a notice, including stockholders who have previously requested to receive paper copies of proxy materials, will receive a paper copy of the proxy materials by mail unless they have previously requested delivery of proxy materials electronically.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Continuing to employ this distribution process will conserve natural resources and reduce the costs of printing and distributing our proxy materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your vote is important to us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Regardless of whether you plan to participate in the annual meeting, we hope you will vote as soon as possible.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may vote by proxy over the Internet or by telephone, or, if you received paper copies of the proxy materials by mail, you may also vote by mail by following the instructions on the proxy card or voting instruction card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Voting over the Internet or by telephone, written proxy or voting instruction card will ensure your representation at the annual meeting regardless of whether you attend the virtual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Finally, I want to sincerely thank each of you for your ongoing support as a stockholder of Hewlett Packard Enterprise Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sincerely,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Patricia F. Russo Chair of the Board
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1)  To elect the 14 directors named in this proxy statement

sentences.text: djournments nd  Any action on the items of business described above may be considered at the annual meeting at the time and on the date specified above or at any time and date to which the annual meeting may be properly adjourned or postponed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Record Date  You are entitled to vote only if you were a Hewlett Packard Enterprise Company stockholder as of the close of business on January 23, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Virtual Meeting Admission  Stockholders of record as of January 23, 2017 will be able to participate in the annual meeting by visiting HPE.onlineshareholdermeeting.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To participate in the annual meeting, you will need the 16-digit control number included on your notice of Internet availability of the proxy materials, on your proxy card or on the instructions that accompanied your proxy materials.The annual meeting will begin promptly at 9:00 a.m., Pacific Time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pre-Meeting  The online format for the annual meeting also allows us to communicate more effectively with you via www.proxyvote.com for beneficial owners and proxyvote.com/hpe for registered stockholders and you can submit questions in advance of the annual meeting, and also access copies of our proxy statement and annual report.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Voting  Your vote is very important to us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Regardless of whether you plan to participate in the annual meeting, we hope you will vote as soon as possible.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may vote your shares over the Internet or via a toll-free telephone number.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you received a paper copy of a proxy or voting instruction card by mail, you may submit your proxy or voting instruction card for the annual meeting by completing, signing, dating and returning your proxy or voting instruction card in the pre-addressed envelope provided.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders of record and beneficial owners will be able to vote their shares electronically at the annual meeting (other than shares held through the Hewlett Packard Enterprise Company 401(k) Plan, which must be voted prior to the meeting).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For specific instructions on how to vote your shares, please refer to the section entitled Questions and AnswersVoting Information beginning on page 94 of the proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxy Statement Executive Summary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following is a summary of proposals to be voted on at the annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This is only a summary, and it may not contain all of the information that is important to you.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For more complete information, please review the proxy statement as well as our 2016 Annual Report, which includes our Annual Report on Form 10-K.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: References to "Hewlett Packard Enterprise," "HPE," "the Company," "we," "us" or "our" refer to Hewlett Packard Enterprise Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On November 1, 2015, HP Inc., formerly known as Hewlett-Packard Company (referred to in this proxy statement as "HP", "HPI", "HP Inc.", "HP Co.", "Parent", or "our former parent") spun-off Hewlett Packard Enterprise Company, pursuant to a separation and distribution agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To effect the spin-off, HP Inc. distributed all of the shares of Hewlett Packard Enterprise common stock owned by HP Inc. to its stockholders on November 1, 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Holders of HP Inc. common stock received one share of Hewlett Packard Enterprise common stock for every share of HP Inc. stock held as of the record date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result of the spin-off, we now operate as an independent, publicly-traded company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Information regarding the skills and qualifications of each nominee can be found on page 27.

sentences.text: Corporate Governance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors is committed to excellence in corporate governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We know that our long-standing tradition of principled, ethical governance benefits you, our stockholders, as well as our customers, employees and communities, and we have developed and continue to maintain a governance profile that aligns with industry-leading standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that the high standards set by our governance structure have had and will continue to have a direct impact on the strength of our business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following table presents a brief summary of highlights of our governance profile, followed by more in-depth descriptions of some of the key aspects of our governance structure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Conduct and Oversight      Independence and Participation      Stockholder Rights    Rigorous stock ownership guidelines, including a 7x base salary requirement for the CEO Regular risk assessment Standards of Business Conduct, applied to all directors, executive officers and employees Annual review of developments in best practices Significant time devoted to succession planning and leadership development efforts Annual evaluations of Board, committees, and individual directors     Independent Chair 12 of 14 directors are independent by NYSE standards Executive sessions of non-management directors generally held at each Board and committee meeting Audit, HRC, and NGSR Committees are each made up entirely of independent directors Governance guidelines express preference for the separation of the Chair and CEO roles     Proxy Access Right for eligible stockholders holding 3% or more of outstanding common stock for at least three years to nominate up to 20% of the Board Special Meeting Right for stockholders of an aggregate of 25% of voting stock All directors annually elected; no staggered Board Majority voting in uncontested director elections No "Poison Pill" No supermajority voting requirements to change organizational documents Expansive direct engagement with stockholders
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: STOCKHOLDER OUTREACH
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have designed a multi-faceted stockholder outreach program focused on providing relevant and accessible information to, and soliciting feedback from, our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The key elements of our stockholder outreach program are the Fall Securities Analyst Meeting, the Winter Board Outreach Program and the Spring Annual Stockholders
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Securities Analyst Meeting        Board Outreach Program        Annual Stockholders Meeting       Purpose: Provide an overview of our strategic vision for the upcoming year Format: Publicly broadcast, so you can access the same information that analysts do       Purpose: Prioritize understanding and responding to your specific perspective and concerns Format: Members of management and our Board meet investors, in a one-on-one setting       Purpose: Provide a corporate update and a forum for management and the Board to answer stockholder questions Format: Completely virtual, so you can join, free of cost, from anywhere
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2017 PROXY STATEMENT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Governance (continued)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our comprehensive stockholder engagement program is supplemented by our year-round investor relations outreach program that includes post-earnings communications, roadshows, bus tours, one-on-one conferences, group meetings, technology webcasts, and general availability to respond to investor inquiries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We design our outreach program to provide continuous and meaningful stockholder engagement and participation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our committed Board of Directors and management team value these interactions and invest meaningful time and resources to ensure that they have an open line of communication with stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During fiscal 2017, our extensive board outreach efforts included off-season engagement with holders of more than 37% of our outstanding common stock as of October 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our discussions with institutional nvestors involved such topics as corporate strategy, recent significant transactions, capital allocation, governance trends and policies, compensation, and corporate citizenship and responsibility.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, our virtual meeting format and pre-meeting forum for our 2016 annual meeting provided for effortless attendance and participation for all our stockholders around the world.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders and other stakeholders may directly communicate with our Board by contacting: Secretary to the Board of Directors, 3000 Hanover Street, MS 1050, Palo Alto, California 94304; e-mail: bod-hpe@hpe.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CORPORATE CITIZENSHIP THROUGH LIVING PROGRESS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We take a thoughtful approach to our global citizenship efforts, called our Living Progress program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This initiative is overseen by the NGSR Committee which regularly reviews, assesses, reports and provides guidance to management and the Board regarding HPE's policies and programs relating to global citizenship and the impact of HPE's operations on employees, customers, suppliers, partners and communities worldwide.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our commitment to corporate citizenship has been rewarded, earning us the distinction of Industry Leader in the 2016 Dow Jones Sustainability Index.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HPE holds the highest industry score globally in five DJSI sections: Corporate Governance, Innovation Management, Corporate Citizenship & Philanthropy, Digital Inclusion and Labor Practice Indicators and Human Rights.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HPE was also ranked #4 on Gartner's Top 10 and Master High-Tech Supply Chains for 2016, receiving a perfect sustainability score.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A few highlights of our Living Progress initiative are detailed below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Human Progress        Economic Progress        Environmental Progress       Uncompromising stance on human rights Sustainable, responsible supply chain       Economic contributions to communities worldwide HPE Company Foundation disaster relief, education, and employee donation efforts       Ecological solutions Product return and recycling Environmentally conscious operations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HEWLETT PACKARD ENTERPRISE BOARD OF DIRECTORS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Establishment of the Board
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As our former parent company prepared to separate into two independent, publicly traded companies, Hewlett Packard Enterprise and HP Inc., the Parent NGSR Committee established two new boards to provide excellent strategic direction and oversight to both companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In late 2014, the Parent NGSR Committee, working with management and an outside director search firm, embarked on a thorough, global search with a focus on finding world-class directors with the diversity of skills, experience, ethnicity and gender to best compliment those of the existing directors, resulting in exceptional leadership for both companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HEWLETT PACKARD ENTERPRISE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2017 PROXY STATEMENT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Governance (continued)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Parent NGSR Committee used a variety of methods for identifying and evaluating nominees for director, solicited recommendations from stockholders and diversity advocate groups, and examined each candidate's professional background and business history extensively to achieve a balance of knowledge, experience and capability on our board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The selection criteria for new directors included:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: high professional and personal ethics and values consistent with our longstanding values and standards;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: broad policy-making experience in business, government, education, technology or public service;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: diversity of background and experience, including: senior leadership and operating experience in a publicly listed company; board experience in a publicly listed company; financial, industrial/technical, brand marketing or international expertise; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: experience as an investor with a commitment to enhancing stockholder value and representation of the interests across our stockholder base.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Finally, each candidate was evaluated to assess whether he or she
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) had appropriate time to devote to the board and company,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) did not have any real or perceived conflicts,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) demonstrated the ability to develop a good working relationship with other members of the board of directors, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) would contribute to the board's working relationship with senior management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The allocation of legacy HP Co. board members to the new Hewlett Packard Enterprise Board was finalized upon completion of the assessment of the full portfolio of skills and experience of current and prospective board members in such a manner to achieve an optimal mix for each post-separation board and an effective committee composition, while maintaining strong continuity and institutional knowledge on each resulting board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eight of our 14 directors are legacy Hewlett-Packard Company directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are committed to implementing and following high standards of corporate governance, which we believe are vital to the success of our business, creation of value for our stockholders and maintenance of our integrity in the marketplace.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our commitment to excellence in governance policies and practices, inherited from the long-standing traditio of our former parent, Hewlett-Packard Company, has flourished throughout our first year of business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following page includes a skills and qualifications matrix highlighting many of the key experiences and competencies our directors bring to Hewlett Packard Enterprise Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board and Committee Meetings and Attendance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board has five regularly scheduled meetings and an annual meeting of stockholders each year, in addition to special meetings scheduled as appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During fiscal 2016, our Board held 17 meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, our five committees held a total of 44 meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of the five regularly scheduled Board meetings held during fiscal 2016 ncluded an executive session, consisting of only non-management directors, and one included a private session consisting of only independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board expects that its members will rigorously prepare for, attend and participate in all Board and applicable Committee meetings and each annual general meeting of stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When directors are unable to attend a meeting, it is our practice to provide all meeting materials to the director, and the Chair or the relevant committee chair consults with and apprises the director of the meeting's subject matter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to participation at Board and committee meetings, our directors discharged their responsibilities throughout the year through personal meetings and other communications, including considerable telephone contact with our Chair, our CEO and other members of senior management regarding matters of interest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of our 14 incumbent directors attended at least 75% of the total number of meetings of the Board of Directors and the total number of meetings held by all committees of the Board of Directors on which each such director served, during the period for which each such director served.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors are also encouraged to attend our annual meeting of stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Last year, each of our directors was in attendance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Leadership Structure
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board is currently led by an independent director, Patricia F. Russo, Chair of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Bylaws and Corporate Governance Guidelines permit the roles of chair of the Board and chief executive officer to be filled by the same or different individuals, although the Corporate Governance Guidelines express a preference for the separation of the two roles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This flexibility allows the Board to determine whether the two roles should be combined or separated based upon our needs and the Board's assessment of its leadership from time to time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that our stockholders are best served at this time by having an independent director serve as Chair of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board believes this leadership structure effectively allocates authority, responsibility, and oversight between management and the independent members of our Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It gives primary responsibility for the operational leadership and strategic direction of the Company to our CEO, while the Chair facilitates our Board's independent oversight of management, promotes communication between senior management and our Board about issues such as management development and succession planning, executive compensation, and company performance, engages with stockholders, and leads our Board's consideration of key governance matters.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: chairs the annual meeting of stockholders,

sentences.text: is available in appropriate circumstances to speak on behalf of the Board, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: performs such other functions and responsibilities as set forth in our Corporate Governance Guidelines or as requested by the Board from time to time.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of the date of this proxy statement, the Board has 14 directors and the following five standing committees: (1) Audit Committee; (2) Finance and Investment Committee; (3) HR and Compensation Committee; (4) Nominating, Governance, and Social Responsibility Committee; and (5) Technology Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The current committee membership and the function of each of these standing committees are described below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of the standing committees operates under a written charter adopted by the Board.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each committee reviews and reassesses the adequacy of their charter annually, conducts annual evaluations of their performance with respect to their duties and responsibilities as laid out in the charter, and reports regularly to the Board with respect to the committees' activities.

sentences.text: Additionally, the Board and each of the committees has the authority to retain, terminate and receive appropriate funding for outside advisors as the Board and/or each committee deems necessary.

sentences.text: Board Risk Oversight
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board, with the assistance of its committees as discussed below, reviews and oversees our enterprise risk management ("ERM") program, which is an enterprise-wide program designed to enable effective and efficient identification of, and management visibility into, critical enterprise risks and to facilitate the incorporation of risk considerations into decision making.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The ERM program was established to clearly define risk management roles and responsibilities, bring together senior management to discuss risk, promote visibility and constructive dialogue around risk at the senior management and Board levels and facilitate appropriate risk response strategies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the ERM program, management develops a holistic portfolio of our enterprise risks by facilitating business and function risk assessments, performing targeted risk assessments and incorporating information regarding specific categories of risk gathered from various internal Hewlett Packard Enterprise organizations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management then develops risk response plans for risks categorized as needing management focus and response and monitors other identified risk focus areas.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management provides reports on the risk portfolio and risk response efforts to senior management and to the Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HEWLETT PACKARD ENTERPRISE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2017 PROXY STATEMENT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Governance (continued)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board oversees management's implementation of the ERM program, including reviewing our enterprise risk portfolio and evaluating management's approach to addressing dentified risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Various Board committees also have responsibilities for oversight of risk management that supplement the ERM program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, the HRC Committee considers the risks associated with our compensation policies and practices as discussed below, the Finance and Investment Committee is responsible for overseeing financial risks, and the NGSR Committee oversees risks associated with our governance structure and processes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This structure allows specialized attention to and oversight over key risk areas by aligning our carefully crafted committees with risk oversight in their individual areas of expertise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board is kept informed of its committees' risk oversight and related activities primarily through reports of the committee chairs to the full Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Audit Committee escalates issues relating to risk oversight to the full Board as appropriate to keep the Board appropriately informed of developments that could affect our risk profile or other aspects of our business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board also considers specific risk topics in connection with strategic planning and other matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Risk Assessment
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During fiscal 2016, we undertook a review of our material compensation processes, policies and programs for all employees and determined that our compensation programs and practices are not reasonably likely to have a material adverse effect on Hewlett Packard Enterprise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In conducting this assessment, we reviewed our compensation risk nfrastructure, including our material plans, our risk control systems and governance structure, the design and oversight of our compensation programs and the developments, mprovements and other changes made to those programs, and we presented a summary of the findings to the HRC Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Overall, we believe that our programs contain an appropriate balance of fixed and variable features and short- and long-term incentives, as well as complementary metrics and reasonable, performance-based goals with near payout curves under most plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that these factors, combined with effective Board and management oversight, operate to mitigate risk and reduce the kelihood of employees engaging in excessive risk-taking behavior with respect to the compensation-related aspects of their jobs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Succession Planning
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Among the HRC Committee's responsibilities described in its charter is to oversee succession planning and leadership development.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board plans for succession of the CEO and annually reviews senior management selection and succession planning that is undertaken by the HRC Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of this process, the independent directors annually review the HRC Committee's recommended candidates for senior management positions to see that qualified candidates are available for all positions and that development plans are being utilized to strengthen the skills and qualifications of the candidates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The criteria used when assessing the qualifications of potential CEO successors include, among others, strategic vision and leadership, operational excellence, financial management, executive officer leadership development, ability to motivate employees, and an ability to develop an effective working relationship with the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: n fiscal 2016, with the spin-off and merger of our Enterprise Services segment, and the subsequent spin-off and merger of our Software segment under way, we engaged in wo robust organization design and talent selection processes to staff both companies, through which management reviewed selection recommendations below the senior eadership level, considering skill sets, performance, potential and diversity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Where the organizational changes altered our pre-existing succession plans, new successors were dentified and relevant talent development plans were implemented.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Evaluations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board conducts an evaluation of the Board, each committee, and individual directors annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The process approved by the Board involves the NGSR Committee, working with the Board Chair, designing each year's evaluation process, selecting from a variety of elements including external evaluators, written evaluations, and group discussions, based on the current dynamics of the Board and of the Company as well as the method of previous annual evaluations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because 2016 was HPE's first year as an NYSE-listed
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The written questionnaires completed by our Board for the 2016 self-evaluation included uestions intended to gauge effectiveness in board composition and conduct; meeting structure; materials; committee composition and effectiveness; strategic and succession lanning; and individual performance.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For a description of the process for nominating directors in accordance with our Bylaws, see "Questions and AnswersStockholder Proposals, Director Nominations and Related Bylaw ProvisionsHow may I recommend individuals to serve as directors and what is the deadline for a director recommendation?" on page 99.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Identifying and Evaluating Candidates for Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The NGSR Committee, in consultation with the Chair, assesses the appropriate size of the Board, as well as the alignment of director skills with company strategy, and whether any vacancies on the Board are expected due to retirement or otherwise, or whether the Board would benefit from the addition of a director with a specific skillset.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event that vacancies are anticipated, or otherwise arise, the NGSR Committee seeks to establish a diverse pool of qualified candidates for consideration.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The NGSR Committee also considers board refreshment in its annual evaluation of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We balance our respect for historical knowledge of our company with our regard for fresh perspectives by considering director tenure on a case-by-case basis, rather than imposing arbitrary term limits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The NGSR Committee uses a variety of methods for identifying and evaluating nominees for director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Candidates may come to the attention of the NGSR Committee through current Board members, professional search firms, stockholders or other persons.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Identified candidates are evaluated at regular or special meetings of the NGSR Committee and may be considered at any point during the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As described above, the NGSR Committee considers properly submitted stockholder recommendations of candidates for the Board to be included in our proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following verification of the stockholder status of individuals proposing
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: candidates, recommendations are considered collectively by the NGSR Committee at a regularly scheduled meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If any materials are provided by a stockholder in connection with the nomination of a director candidate, such materials are forwarded to the NGSR Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The NGSR Committee also reviews materials provided by professional search firms and other parties in connection with a nominee who is not proposed by a stockholder.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In evaluating such nominations, the NGSR Committee seeks to achieve a balance of knowledge, experience and capability on the Board that will enable the Board to effectively oversee the business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The NGSR Committee evaluates nominees recommended by stockholders using the same criteria as it uses to evaluate all other candidates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We engage a professional search firm on an ongoing basis to identify and assist the NGSR Committee in identifying, evaluating and conducting due diligence on potential director nominees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In each instance, the NGSR Committee considers the totality of the circumstances of each individual candidate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Limits on Director Service on Other Public Company Boards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have a highly effective and engaged Board, and we believe that our directors' outside directorships enable them to contribute valuable knowledge and experience to the HPE Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nonetheless, the Board is sensitive to the external obligations of its directors and the potential for overboarding to compromise the ability of these directors to effectively serve on the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HPE's Corporate Governance Guidelines limit each director's service on other boards of public companies to a number that permits them, given their individual circumstances, to perform responsibly all director duties and, in all events, this service may not exceed four other public company boards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Further, the ability of each director to devote sufficient time and attention to director duties is expressly considered as part of the annual board self-evaluation process, which aims to evaluate the effectiveness and engagement of HPE's directors, including in the context of their external commitments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the Board certainly considers its directors' outside directorships during this evaluation process, the Board recognizes that this is one of many outside obligations which could potentially impair a director's capacity to dedicate sufficient time and focus to their service on the HPE Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As such, the Board evaluates many factors when assessing the effectiveness and active involvement of each director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such other factors include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The director's attendance at Board and committee meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The director's participation and level of engagement during these meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The role played by the director on the Board of HPE, as well as on his or her outside boards, including committee membership and chairmanship.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The experience and expertise of the director, including both relevant industry experience and service on other (related) public company boards, which enable director to serve on multiple boards effectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We schedule our board and committee meetings up to two years in advance, to ensure director availability and maximum participation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors serve for one-year terms; accordingly, there is an opportunity to evaluate annually each director's ability to serve.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Independence
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Corporate Governance Guidelines provide that a substantial majority of the Board will consist of independent directors and that the Board can include no more than three directors who are not independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These standards are available on our website at http://investors.hpe.com/governance/guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our director independence standards generally reflect the NYSE corporate governance listing standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, each member of the Audit Committee and the HRC Committee meets the heightened independence standards required for such committee members under the applicable listing standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HEWLETT PACKARD ENTERPRISE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2017 PROXY STATEMENT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Governance (continued)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under our Corporate Governance Guidelines, a director will not be considered independent in the following circumstances:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) The director is, or has been within the last three years, an employee of Hewlett Packard Enterprise, or an immediate family member of the director is, or has been within the last three years, an executive officer of Hewlett Packard Enterprise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (2) The director has been employed as an executive officer of Hewlett Packard Enterprise, its subsidiaries or affiliates within the last five years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (3) The director has received, or has an immediate family member who has received, during any 12-month period within the last three years, more than $120,000 in direct compensation from Hewlett Packard Enterprise, other than compensation for Board service, compensation received by a director's immediate family member for service as a non-executive employee of Hewlett Packard Enterprise, or pension or other forms of deferred compensation for prior service with Hewlett Packard Enterprise that is not contingent on continued service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (4) (A) The director or an immediate family member is a current partner of the firm that is our internal or external auditor; (B) the director is a current employee of such a firm; (C) the director has an immediate family member who is a current employee of such a firm and who participates in the firm's audit, assurance or tax compliance (but not tax planning) practice; or (D) the director or an immediate family member was within the last three years (but is no longer) a partner or employee of such a firm and personally worked on our audit within that time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (5) The director or an immediate family member is, or has been in the past three years, employed as an executive officer of another company where any of our present executive officers at the same time serves or has served on that company's compensation committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (6) The director is a current employee, or an immediate family member is a current executive officer, of a company that has made payments to, or received payments from, Hewlett Packard Enterprise for property or services in an amount which, in any of the last three fiscal years, exceeds the greater of $1 million or 2% of such other company's consolidated gross revenues.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (7) The director is affiliated with a charitable organization that receives significant contributions from Hewlett Packard Enterprise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (8) The director has a personal services contract with Hewlett Packard Enterprise or an executive officer of Hewlett Packard Enterprise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: r these purposes, an "immediate family member" includes a director's spouse, parents, step-parents, children, step-children, siblings, mother-in-law, father-in-law, sons-in- w, daughters-in-law, brothers-in-law, sisters-in-law, and any person (other than tenants or employees) who shares the director's home.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: n determining independence, the Board reviews whether directors have any material relationship with Hewlett Packard Enterprise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An independent director must not have any material relationship with Hewlett Packard Enterprise, either directly or as a partner, stockholder or officer of an organization that has a relationship with Hewlett Packard Enterprise, nor any relationship that would interfere with the exercise of independent judgment in carrying out the responsibilities of a director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In assessing the materiality of a director's relationship to Hewlett Packard Enterprise, the Board considers all relevant facts and circumstances, including consideration of the issues from the director's standpoint and from the perspective of the persons or organizations with which the director has an affiliation, and is guided by the standards set forth above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HEWLETT PACKARD ENTERPRISE

sentences.text: In making its independence determinations, the Board considered transactions occurring since the beginning of fiscal 2014 between Hewlett Packard Enterprise, and/or its former parent HP Inc., as applicable, and entities associated with the independent directors or their immediate family members.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board's independence determinations included consideration of the following transactions:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Ammann is the President of General Motors Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HP Inc. and/or Hewlett Packard Enterprise have each entered into transactions for the purchase and/or sale of goods and services in the ordinary course of its business during the past three fiscal years with General Motors Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The amount that HP Inc. or Hewlett Packard Enterprise paid in each of the last three fiscal years to General Motors Company, and the amount received in each fiscal year by HP Inc. or Hewlett Packard Enterprise from General Motors Company, did not, in any of the previous three fiscal years, exceed the greater of $1 million or 2% of General Motors Company's consolidated gross revenues.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Angelakis is a senior advisor to the executive management committee of Comcast Corporation and until July 2015 served as Vice Chairman and Chief Financial Officer of Comcast Corporation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Carter served as a Vice President of Cummins Inc. until April 2015.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These business relationships were as a supplier or purchaser of goods or services in the ordinary course of business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result of this review, the Board has determined the transactions and relationships described above would not interfere with the director's exercise of independent judgment n carrying out the responsibilities of a director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has also determined that, with the exception of Mr. Lane and Ms. Livermore, each current non-employee director, ncluding Mr. Ammann, Mr. Andreessen, Mr. Angelakis, Mr. Brun, Ms. Carter, Mr. Kleinfeld, Mr. Ozzie, Mr. Reiner, Ms. Russo, Mr. Tan, Mrs. Wilderotter and each of the members of the Audit Committee, the HRC Committee and the NGSR Committee, has no material relationship with Hewlett Packard Enterprise (either directly or as a partner, stockholder or officer of an organization that has a relationship with Hewlett Packard Enterprise) and is independent within the meaning of our and NYSE director independence standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has determined that
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) Mr. Lane is independent by NYSE standards but not under our stricter standards because of his former role as executive chairman of the board of HP Inc.,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) Ms. Livermore is not independent under either standard because she was an employee of Hewlett Packard Enterprise through October 31, 2016 and was an executive officer of our former parent within the last five fiscal years, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) Ms. Whitman is not independent because of her status as our current President and CEO.

sentences.text: Director Compensation and Stock Ownership Guidelines
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-employee director compensation is determined by the Board, acting on the recommendation of the HRC Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In formulating its recommendation, the HRC Committee considers market data for our peer group and input from the third-party compensation consultant retained by the HRC Committee regarding market practices for director compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors who are employees of the Company or its affiliates do not receive any separate compensation for their board activities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The HRC Committee intends to set director compensation levels at or near the market median to ensure directors are paid competitively for their time commitment and esponsibilities relative to directors at companies of comparable size, industry, and scope of operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As noted above, during fiscal 2016, FW Cook conducted a review of director compensation levels relative to the peer group, which indicated that the current program was providing compensation within the range of the median and thus was aligned with its philosophy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No changes were made to compensation levels as a result of the fiscal 2016 review.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The HRC Committee intends to conduct such reviews annually
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During fiscal 2016, non-employee directors were compensated for their service as shown in the chart below
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PAY COMPONENT DIRECTOR COMPENSATION ADDITIONAL INFORMATION(1) Annual Cash Retainer  $100,000  For 2015 Board year, may elect to receive 100% in equity  For 2016 board year, may elect to receive up to 100% in HPE Stock , which may be deferred for calendar year 2017 Annual Equity Retainer  $175,000 converted to restricted stock units  May defer up to 100% Meeting Fees  $2,000 for each board meeting in excess of ten  $2,000 for each committee meeting in excess of ten  Paid in cash  For 2016 board year, may elect to receive up to 100% in HPE Stock , which may be deferred for calendar year 2017 Chairman of the Board Fee  $200,000  For 2016 board year, may elect to receive up to 100% in HPE Stock , which may be deferred for calendar year 2017 Committee Chair Fees  Lead independent director: $35,000  Audit committee: $25,000  HRC committee: $20,000  All others: $15,000  For 2016 board year, may elect to receive up to 100% in HPE Stock , which may be deferred for calendar year 2017 Stock Ownership Guidelines  5x annual cash retainer ($500,000)  Shares held by the director, directly or indirectly, and deferred vested RSUs are included in the stock ownership calculation  Must be met within five years of election to the Board (2) (3) (4) (5) (6) (5) (4) (5) (4) (5) (4) (5)

sentences.text: (1) For purposes of determining director compensation, we use a compensation year that generally commences with the month in which the Annual Stockholders' Meeting is held, and ends the twelfth month after that date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This aligns with our Annual Stockholders' Meeting, but does not coincide with our November through October fiscal year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, the pay components for the director compensation program for fiscal 2016 reflect program guidelines during both the 2015 and 2016 board years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2015 board year began with the launch of HPE in November 2015 and ended in February 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2016 board year began in March 2016 and will continue until February 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (2) Annual cash retainer is paid in quarterly installments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (3) For the 2015 board year, directors were permitted to elect equity either entirely in RSUs or in equal values of RSUs and stock options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (5) Deferral elections are made in December, and effective for the following calendar year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For calendar year 2016, directors could defer RSUs received in lieu of cash and up to $50,000 of cash.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For calendar year 2017, directors were permitted to elect to defer all or a portion of any compensation received in the form of RSUs or shares of HPE stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (6) RSUs generally vest on the earlier of the date of the annual shareholder meeting in the following year, or after one year from the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors receive dividend equivalent units with respect to RSUs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 16(a) Beneficial Ownership Reporting Compliance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 16(a) of the Exchange Act, requires our directors, executive officers and holders of more than 10% of Hewlett Packard Enterprise's stock to file reports with the SEC regarding their ownership and changes in ownership of our securities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based upon our examination of the copies of Forms 3, 4, and 5, and amendments thereto furnished to us and the written representations of our directors, executive officers and 10% stockholders, we believe that, during fiscal 2016, our directors, executive officers and 10% stockholders complied with all Section 16(a) filing requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RELATED PERSONS TRANSACTIONS POLICIES AND PROCEDURES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have adopted a written policy for approval of transactions between us and our directors, director nominees, executive officers, beneficial owners of more than five percent (5%) of Hewlett Packard Enterprise's stock, and their respective immediate family members where the amount involved in the transaction exceeds or is expected to exceed $120,000 in a single 12-month period and such "related persons" have or will have a direct or indirect material interest (other than solely as a result of being a director or a less than ten percent (10%) beneficial owner of another entity).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The policy provides that the NGSR Committee reviews certain transactions subject to the policy and decides whether or not to approve or ratify those transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In doing so, the NGSR Committee determines whether the transaction is in the best interests of Hewlett Packard Enterprise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In making that determination, the NGSR Committee takes into account, among other factors it deems appropriate:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the extent of the related person's interest in the transaction;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: whether the transaction is on terms generally available to an unaffiliated third party under the same or similar circumstances;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the benefits to Hewlett Packard Enterprise;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the impact or potential impact on a director's independence in the event the related party is a director, an immediate family member of a director or an entity in which a director is a partner, 10% stockholder or executive officer;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the availability of other sources for comparable products or services; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the terms of the transaction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HEWLETT PACKARD ENTERPRISE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Governance (continued)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The NGSR Committee has delegated authority to the chair of the NGSR Committee to pre-approve or ratify transactions where the aggregate amount involved is expected to be less than $1 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A summary of any new transactions pre-approved by the chair is provided to the full NGSR Committee for its review at each of the NGSR Committee's regularly scheduled meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The NGSR Committee has adopted standing pre-approvals under the policy for limited transactions with related persons.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pre-approved transactions include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1. compensation of executive officers that is excluded from reporting under SEC rules where the HRC Committee approved (or recommended that the Board approve) such compensation;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2. director compensation;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3. transactions with another company with a value that does not exceed the greater of $1 million or 2% of the other company's annual revenues, where the related person has an interest only as an employee (other than executive officer), director or beneficial holder of less than 10% of the other company's shares;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 4. contributions to a charity in an amount that does not exceed $1 million or 2% of the charity's annual receipts, where the related person has an interest only as an employee (other than executive officer) or director; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 5. transactions where all stockholders receive proportional benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: summary of new transactions covered by the standing pre-approvals described in paragraphs 3 and 4 above is provided to the NGSR Committee for its review in connection ith that committee's regularly scheduled meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fiscal 2016 Related Person Transactions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We enter into commercial transactions with many entities for which our executive officers or directors serve as directors and/or executive officers in the ordinary course of our business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of those transactions were pre-approved transactions as defined above or were ratified by the NGSR Committee or our Parent's NGSR Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Hewlett Packard Enterprise considers all pre-approved or ratified transactions to have been at arm's-length and does not believe that any of our executive officers or directors had a material direct or indirect interest in any of such commercial transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, Mr. Lane's daughter, Kristi Rawlinson, serves as a non-executive employee of Hewlett Packard Enterprise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to becoming an employee in 2013, Ms. Rawlinson previously served as a consultant to ArcSight Inc. and, subsequently, HP Inc., following its acquisition of ArcSight.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The amount received by Ms. Rawlinson in her role at Hewlett Packard Enterprise totaled approximately $165,000 in fiscal 2016.

sentences.text: Election of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On the recommendation of the NGSR Committee, the Board has nominated the 14 persons named below for election as directors this year, each to serve for a one-year term or until the director's successor is elected and qualified.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DIRECTOR NOMINEE EXPERIENCE AND QUALIFICATIONS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board annually reviews the appropriate skills and characteristics required of directors in the context of the current composition of the Board, our operating requirements, and the long-term interests of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that its members should possess a variety of skills, professional experience and backgrounds in order to effectively oversee our business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Board believes that each director should possess certain attributes, as reflected in the Board membership criteria described below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Corporate Governance Guidelines contain the current Board membership criteria that apply to nominees recommended for a position on the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under those criteria, members of the Board should have the highest professional and personal ethics and values, consistent with our long-standing values and standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: They should have broad experience at the policy-making level in business, government, education, technology or public service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: They should be committed to enhancing stockholder value and should have sufficient time to carry out their duties and to provide insight and practical wisdom based on experience.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the NGSR Committee takes into account a potential director's ability to contribute to the diversity of background and experience represented on the Board, and it reviews its effectiveness in balancing these considerations when assessing the composition of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors' service on other boards of public companies should be limited to a number that permits them, given their individual circumstances, to perform responsibly all director duties.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each director must represent the interests of all of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although the Board uses these and other criteria as appropriate to evaluate potential nominees, it has no stated minimum criteria for nominees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that all the nominees named below are highly qualified and have the skills and experience required for effective service on the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The nominees' individual biographies below contain information about their experience, qualifications and skills that led the Board to nominate them.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of the nominees have indicated to us that they will be available to serve as directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event that any nominee should become unavailable, the proxy holders, Margaret C. Whitman, Timothy C. Stonesifer and John F. Schultz, will vote for a nominee or nominees designated by the Board, or the Board may decrease the size of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There are no family relationships among our executive officers and directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board recommends a vote FOR the election to the Board of each of the following nominees
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: VOTE REQUIRED
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each director nominee who receives more "FOR" votes than "AGAINST" votes representing shares of Hewlett Packard Enterprise common stock present in person or represented by proxy and entitled to be voted at the annual meeting will be elected.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you sign your proxy or voting instruction card but do not give instructions with respect to voting for directors, your shares will be voted by Margaret C. Whitman, Timothy C. Stonesifer and John F. Schultz, as proxy holders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you wish to give specific instructions with respect to voting for directors, you may do so by indicating your instructions on your proxy or voting instruction card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DIRECTOR ELECTION VOTING STANDARD AND RESIGNATION POLICY
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Bylaws provide for a majority vote standard in the uncontested election of directors, meaning that, for a nominee to be elected, the number of shares voted "for" the nominee must exceed the votes cast "against" the nominee's election.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders are not permitted to cumulate their votes in favor of one or more director nominees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, we have adopted a policy whereby any incumbent director nominee who receives a greater number of votes "against" his or her election than votes "for" such election will tender his or her resignation for consideration by the NGSR Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The NGSR Committee will recommend to the Board the action to be taken with respect to such offer of resignation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal No. 2:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ratification of Independent Registered Public Accounting Firm
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee of the Board has appointed, and as a matter of good corporate governance, is requesting ratification by the stockholders of, Ernst & Young LLP as the independent registered public accounting firm to audit our consolidated and combined financial statements for the fiscal year ending October 31, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During fiscal 2016, Ernst & Young LLP served as our independent registered public accounting firm and also provided certain other audit-related and tax services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See "Principal Accounting Fees and Services" on page 88 and "Report of the Audit Committee of the Board of Directors" on page 90.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Representatives of Ernst & Young LLP are expected to participate in the annual meeting, where they will be available to respond to appropriate questions and, if they desire, to make a statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: VOTE REQUIRED
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ratification of the appointment of Ernst & Young LLP as our independent registered public accounting firm for the 2017 fiscal year requires the affirmative vote of a majority of the shares of Hewlett Packard Enterprise common stock present in person or represented by proxy and entitled to be voted at the annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the appointment is not ratified, the Board will consider whether it should select another independent registered public accounting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RECOMMENDATION OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board recommends a vote FOR the ratification of the appointment of Ernst & Young LLP as our independent registered public accounting firm for the 2017 fiscal year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal No. 3:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Advisory Vote to Approve Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors (the "Board") and HR and Compensation Committee of the Board (the "HRC Committee") are committed to excellence in corporate governance and to executive compensation programs that align the interests of our executives with those of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To fulfill this mission, we have a pay-for-performance philosophy that forms the foundation for all decisions regarding compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation programs have been structured to balance near-term results with long-term success, and enable us to attract, retain, focus, and reward our executive team for delivering stockholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Below is a summary of key elements of our fiscal compensation programs relative to this philosophy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PAY-FOR-PERFORMANCE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Design compensation programs that do not encourage imprudent risk-taking

sentences.text: Enter into individual executive compensation agreements

sentences.text: Provide tax gross-ups for executive perquisites

sentences.text: Maintain stock ownership guidelines for executive officers, including a rigorous 7x base salary requirement for the CEO
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pay share-dividend equivalents in our long-term incentive program before the vesting of the underlying shares occurs
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Provide limited executive perquisites
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Provide supplemental defined benefit pension plans (except in the case of international transfers)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prohibit hedging or pledging of Company stock
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Maintain a clawback policy that permits the Board to recover annual and long-term incentives
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Maintain a severance policy that provides for "double-trigger" change of control equity vesting
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Engage an independent compensation consultant for the HRC Committee that does no other work for the Company
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Executive Compensation portion of this proxy statement contains a detailed description of our compensation philosophy and programs, the compensation decisions made under those programs with regard to our named executive officers ("NEOs"), and the factors considered by the HRC Committee in making those decisions for Fiscal 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that we maintain a compensation program deserving of stockholder support.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, the Board of Directors recommends stockholder approval of the compensation of our NEOs as disclosed in this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board recommends a vote FOR the approval of the compensation of our named executive officers, including the Compensation Discussion and Analysis, the compensation tables and narrative discussion following such compensation tables, and the other related disclosures in this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 162(m)-Related Provisions of 2015 Company Stock Incentive Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HPE sponsors the Hewlett Packard Enterprise Company 2015 Stock Incentive Plan (as amended and restated on January 25, 2017) (the "Plan").
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to the separation of HPE from Hewlett-Packard Company ("HP"), the Plan was approved by the pre-separation stockholder of HPE.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Plan has been subsequently amended from time to time
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board is now asking HPE stockholders to approve the provisions of the Plan that are required to be approved by stockholders in order for HPE to continue to be eligible for a federal tax deduction for "performance-based compensation" paid to certain of HPE's officers pursuant to the Plan under Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended (the "Code").
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 162(m) of the Code generally disallows a tax deduction to public companies for any year for compensation in excess of $1 million paid to a company's chief executive officer or any of the three other most highly compensated officers excluding the chief financial officer (collectively, the "Covered Officers").
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: "Performance-based compensation" is specifically exempt from the deduction limit if it otherwise meets the requirements of Section 162(m) of the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With stockholder approval of the provisions, HPE may continue to make grants or pay cash amounts to Covered Officers (and other officers who may reasonably be expected o be a Covered Officer when the relevant compensation is paid) that are intended to constitute "performance-based compensation" and take federal tax deductions for amounts paid in connection with the grants and cash payments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If our stockholders fail to approve of the relevant provisions, then the Plan and HPE's grants thereunder will continue, except that HPE will no longer make grants under the Plan to Covered Officers (and other officers who may reasonably be expected to be a Covered Officer when the relevant compensation is paid) to the extent the grants are intended to constitute "performance-based compensation" for purposes of Section 162(m) of the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nothing in he Plan limits HPE's right to make grants that are not considered "performance-based compensation" and exceed the deduction limit set forth in Section 162(m) of the Code, but if the stockholders fail to approve the relevant provisions of the Plan, no employee has a guaranteed right to any grant as a substitute for a grant that would have constituted "performance-based compensation" if the stockholders had approved the relevant provisions of the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Summary of the Provisions of the Plan Required to be Approved by Stockholders for Purposes of Section 162(m) of the Code
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholder approval of this proposal will constitute stockholder approval of specific provisions described below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following summary of the provisions of the Plan related to Section 162(m) of the Code does not purport to be a complete description of all of the provisions of the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is qualified in its entirety by reference to the complete text of the Plan, which has been filed with the SEC as Annex A to this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any HPE stockholder who wishes to obtain a copy of the Plan may do so upon written request to he Secretary at HPE's principal executive offices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eligibility.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Grants may be made under the Plan to employees of HPE and its affiliates and to non-employee directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Incentive stock options may be granted only to employees of HPE or its subsidiaries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of October 31, 2016, there were approximately 80,000 employees and thirteen non-employee directors eligible to receive grants under the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Administrator (as defined below), in its discretion, selects the employees to whom grants may be made, the time or times at which the grants are made, and the terms of the grants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Grants for non-employee director are not subject to Section 162(m) of the Code and are described below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN
